bill.title: Establishing a Select Investigative Panel of the Committee on Energy and Commerce.
bill.description: Establishing a Select Investigative Panel of the Committee on Energy and Commerce. Establishes a Select Investigative Panel of the House Committee on Energy and Commerce. (Sec. 3) Requires the Panel to investigate and report on: medical procedures and business practices used by entities involved in fetal tissue procurement; any other relevant matters with respect to such procurement; federal funding and support for abortion providers; the practices of providers of second and third trimester abortions, including partial birth abortion and procedures that may lead to a child born alive as a result of an attempted abortion; medical procedures for the care of a child born alive as a result of an attempted abortion; and any changes in law or regulation necessary resulting from such findings. (Sec. 6) Terminates the Panel 30 days after filing its final report.

history.action: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-288, by Ms. Foxx.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 63.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H6869-6879; text of measure as reported in House: CR H6869)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 461.
H.Amdt.710 Amendment (A001) offered by Ms. Foxx. (consideration: CR H6878-6879; text: CR H6878)
H.Amdt.710 The previous question was ordered on the amendment (A001) without objection. (consideration: CR H6879)
H.Amdt.710 On agreeing to the Foxx amendment (A001) Agreed to by voice vote.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 242 - 184 (Roll no. 538).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
